comments:
3.3M7 I20070503-1400

I don't have working steps for this yet.

I renamed (refactored) a "HistoryQueue" class constructor to "WindowQueue" in-place.  (There was a breakpoint on a method in that class, all breakpoints were disabled and the code had just been run).  A refactoring preview dialogue appeared along with an error:

<init>(int) [in WindowQueue [in [Working copy] WindowQueue.java [in <default> [in src [in project]]]]] does not exist.

Logs suggest there was a problem moving the breakpoint when renaming the type.  Now if I add a breakpoint in the same Eclipse instance (not restarting) and rename the type the breakpoint gets deleted - the error seems to have caused the breakpoint refactoring participant to be removed.


eclipse.buildId=I20070503-1400
java.version=1.6.0
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_GB

(I may have encountered bug 158807 shortly before seeing this bug but I suspect this is unrelated).

Seems similar to bug 162987 (among others with similar stack traces, all of which seem to be resolved) but I'm quite sure I had no breakpoints on static methods.

I can reproduce this placing a mehtod entry breakpoint on a constructor. We are not searching for the correct name range for the constructor name which appears as "<init>" no matter what you rename the files as.

Investigating

traces.message: <init>(int) [in WindowQueue [in [Working copy] WindowQueue.java [in <default> [in src [in project]]]]] does not exist
